img.alt: Important Update in Red with Red box around it
img.title: Important Update in Red with Red box around it

p.span: Dear Exeter Township School District Community,
I wanted to reach out and update you on where we are right now with regard to our current school closure and future of the Continuity of Education (instructional plan).
Governor Wolfe spoke today to ask all of us to stay the course. We are currently 5
th

in confirmed Coronavirus cases in the country but there are signs of success for following our social distancing. He discussed a plan for relief, re-opening, and recovery that included the need for data driven, quantifiable criteria to guide decisions. He will be providing guidance in the future for employers, individuals, and businesses. His recommendation for opening the state will happen when we have adequate testing and supplies of personal protection gear. It will involve continuing monitoring and surveillance programs. The plan will also include continued protection for our most vulnerable citizens. Finally, the limitation of large gatherings will remain until all phases of the plan are completed. We will continue to monitor the situation and its effect on our school district.

Today marks the first week of distance learning. We are constantly reflecting and looking for ways to be better! Adding content this week has brought challenges to our distance learning, but we continue to work through those challenges. I was made aware of the internet outage that occurred yesterday. It was a fiber optic issue that has been fixed but it continues to occur in districts across our county. I am hopeful this will not occur in the future. Thank you to those parents who took the time to say thanks for our efforts and thank you to those parents who took the time to offer constructive feedback. Teams are already applying feedback and suggestions to make the next few weeks more effective.

Our leadership team met yesterday. We talked about procedural/process-oriented steps we can take to make virtual learning more efficient and effective. We shared parent feedback, positive and constructive. We focused the majority of our conversation on perspective taking, and how to serve. Please ask for help - we have many staff ready and willing to help!

We are posting assignments for all to access knowing distance learning can never replace the individualized, fluid, dynamic and engaging process we experience in our classrooms. If your student finishes work or seeks additional activities, please be sure to access the many varied resources posted on our district website. Please also look on the links provided to access resources in the areas of home challenges, mental health issues, and activities to positively engage learners and families, etc.

Working equipment and effective use of technology are integral to our success. Please be sure you have a working device. If there is a concern with your device or are still in need of a Chromebook, please access technical support on our website or call 610-898-9585 option 6.
Dr Robert Phillips, Superintendent of Schools
Stay safe
Important Links

a.aria-label: Berks County Coronavirus Resource Page - Opens a new window

a.span: Exeter Cares - Connecting Our Community While Socially Distant

div.p: Everyone needs a helping hand, sometimes. In the midst of the current global COVID-19 pandemic, we find ourselves in uncharted territory. Perhaps now, more than ever, we need to do more - help more - be more. Click here for more information about ExeterCares

a.title: Go to comments for Exeter Cares - Connecting Our Community While Socially Distant

div.p: Please click the headline to view more specific information concerning the virtual instruction that will begin Monday, April 6, 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for Plan for Continued Learning - April 5th

a.span: Service Electric Cablevision offers students,teachers 90 days of free home internet to assist with elearning

div.p: 90 days internet for students and teachers from Service Electric. Please click headline for more information

a.title: Go to comments for Service Electric Cablevision offers students,teachers 90 days of free home internet to assist with elearning

a.span: Chromebook Distribution for Students Without a Device

div.p: We have limited Chromebooks to provide to students that need devices to complete school work. Please click the headline for Signup information.

a.title: Go to comments for Chromebook Distribution for Students Without a Device

div.p: During the closure, the district will be operating technical support remotely as much as possible. We will be setting hours at the administration building to address hardware repair. Click here for more info and to submit a ticket.

a.title: Go to comments for Requesting Support for District Devices

a.span: Online Academic Resources for Students During Homebound Instruction Time

div.p: These resources are provided as a courtesy during this period of closure and are not graded assignments. Their purpose is to help families keep their children engaged as learners by maintaining and/or extending their learning.

a.title: Go to comments for Online Academic Resources for Students During Homebound Instruction Time

a.span: ECEF and EHSEAA Buy a Brick Fundraiser: Phase 2

div.p: Purchase a personalized engraved brick that will be a permanent part of the Exeter Twp Senior High Eagle's statue. Proceeds to benifit the ECEF and Exeter High School Eagles Alumni Assoc. Scholarship Funds. Click the headline for more info

a.title: Go to comments for ECEF and EHSEAA Buy a Brick Fundraiser: Phase 2

div.p: Over the past year, the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) issued regular updates to school districts on the details of Pennsylvanias Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) State Plan and the implementation of the Future Ready PA Index. Click Here for details

a.title: Go to comments for Exeter ESSA Report Card

div.p: In partnership with Sandy Hook Promise, the Pennsylvania Office of Attorney General will implement the Safe 2 Say Something anonymous tip line effective January 14, 2019.

a.title: Go to comments for Safe 2 Say Something

a.span: Process For Email Submission of Absence Excuses

div.p: Each Building's webpage has the Attendance email Address.All buildings accept emailed absence notes. Emails must come from email address in Skyward. Click headline for more info.
